meanings.definition: A person who strives for perfection in their work or activities.
meanings.sent1: As a perfectionist, Sarah always double-checks her homework to make sure it is flawless.
meanings.sent2: The perfectionist spent hours perfecting the details of his painting.
meanings.sent3: The perfectionist chef refused to serve the dish until every ingredient was measured precisely.
meanings.sent4: Her perfectionist nature was like a magnifying glass, highlighting every flaw in the project.
meanings.sent5: Being a perfectionist, he could spot even the tiniest mistake from a mile away.

meanings.definition: Someone who is excessively concerned with details and accuracy.
meanings.sent1: The perfectionist meticulously organized her desk, ensuring everything was in its proper place.
meanings.sent2: The perfectionist's attention to detail made him the ideal candidate for the job.
meanings.sent3: The perfectionist's obsession with precision extended to color-coding his sock drawer.
meanings.sent4: Her perfectionist tendencies were like a finely tuned instrument, always seeking harmony.
meanings.sent5: The perfectionist's focus on accuracy was unmatched, catching even the smallest errors.

meanings.definition: A person who has high standards and expectations for themselves and others.
meanings.sent1: As a perfectionist, he set the bar high for both himself and his team.
meanings.sent2: The perfectionist's standards were so high that few could meet them.
meanings.sent3: The perfectionist's insistence on excellence sometimes led to frustration among colleagues.
meanings.sent4: Her perfectionist mindset was like a beacon, guiding others towards excellence.
meanings.sent5: Being a perfectionist meant constantly pushing boundaries to achieve greatness.
